info.title: Terra-Boot API
info.description: RESTful Services to interact with terraform CLI

tags.name: RetrieveTerraformResult
tags.description: APIs to manually fetching task results from terra-boot.

tags.name: TerraformFromScripts
tags.description: APIs for running Terraform commands on the scripts sent via request body.

tags.name: Admin
tags.description: Admin services for managing the application.

tags.name: TerraformFromDirectory
tags.description: APIs for running Terraform commands inside a provided directory.

tags.name: TerraformFromGitRepo
tags.description: APIs for running Terraform commands using Terraform scripts from a GIT Repo.

post.description: Method to batch retrieve stored terraform result from terra-boot.
Get Terraform Plan as JSON string from the list of script files provided
Get Terraform Plan as JSON string from the list of script files provided
Get Terraform Plan as JSON string from the given directory.

parameters.name: module_directory
parameters.description: directory name where the Terraform module files exist.

post.description: Modify resources via Terraform from the given directory.

parameters.name: module_directory
parameters.description: directory name where the Terraform module files exist.

post.description: async modify resources via Terraform from the given directory.

parameters.name: module_directory
parameters.description: directory name where the Terraform module files exist.

post.description: Deploy resources via Terraform from the given directory.

parameters.name: module_directory
parameters.description: directory name where the Terraform module files exist.

post.description: async deploy resources via Terraform from the given directory.

parameters.name: module_directory
parameters.description: directory name where the Terraform module files exist.

get.description: Method to retrieve stored terraform result in case terra-boot receives a failure while sending the terraform result via callback.
Check health of Terra Boot API service
Validate the Terraform modules in the given directory.

parameters.name: module_directory
parameters.description: directory name where the Terraform module files exist.

parameters.name: terraform_version
parameters.description: version of Terraform to execute the module files.

delete.description: Destroy the resources from the given directory.

parameters.name: module_directory
parameters.description: directory name where the Terraform module files exist.

delete.description: async destroy resources via Terraform from the given directory.

parameters.name: module_directory
parameters.description: directory name where the Terraform module files exist.

enum: Result Already Returned or RequestId Invalid

success.description: Describes if the request is successful

state.description: State of the re-fetching result of order.

terraformResult.description: Result of the service order executed by terraform.

errorMessage.description: Error message of the re-fetching result of order.

commandStdOutput.description: stdout of the command returned as string.

commandStdError.description: stderr of the command returned as string.

generatedFileContentMap.description: Data of all other files generated by the terraform execution.The map key contains the file name and value is the file contents as string.

terraformVersionUsed.description: The version of the Terraform binary used to execute scripts.

terraformVersion.description: The required version of terraform which will execute the scripts.

isPlanOnly.description: Flag to control if the deployment must only generate the terraform or it must also apply the changes.

variables.description: Key-value pairs of variables that must be used to execute the Terraform request.

envVariables.description: Key-value pairs of variables that must be injected as environment variables to terraform process.

scriptFiles.description: Map stores file name and content of all script files for deploy request.

valid.description: Defines if the Terraform scripts is valid.

terraformVersionUsed.description: The version of the Terraform binary used to execute scripts.

terraformVersion.description: The required version of terraform which will execute the scripts.

variables.description: Key-value pairs of variables that must be used to execute the Terraform request.

envVariables.description: Key-value pairs of variables that must be injected as environment variables to terraform process.

scriptFiles.description: Map stores file name and content of all script files for generating terraform plan.

plan.description: Terraform plan as a JSON string
